Hi! This is a Google classroom for seniors who are taking or who have taken IT classes in the past.
Why? Because there are some things that seniors have to do because of CTEC.
Also, there are lots of IT related scholarships or opportunities that you might qualify now that you are a senior. Free money for college or other opportunities. 

For example, here is one specifically for CTEC after graduation.
https://www.c-tec.edu/page/scholarships

See, content like this will be helpful! 😎

Tons of successful grads are on this group and might help you find a new job or internship. Today, I posted some leads on IT jobs at, get this, White Castle. I think that if I had an internship at White Castle, I would be the happiest person in the universe. 
So anyway, if you are interested, check it out!

From THK 


I wanted to send out a reminder about our Spring THK Day that we are hosting on Thursday, May 4 at our facility in Hebron (471 N. High St., Hebron, Ohio, 43025). This event is open to all students, community members, and the public of all ages!
 The informational event will take place from 5-7 p.m. and will include a
 company presentation, a facility tour, and a breakout session where you
 get to meet current THK employees. We will also be providing pizza for 
everyone who joins us. A tentative schedule of events is listed below:
 
THK Day Tentative Schedule – May 4, 2023
5-5:15 p.m. – Registration
5:15-5:45 p.m. – Company Presentation
5:45-6:30 p.m. – Facility Tour
6:30-7 p.m. – THK Employee Meet & Greet
 
To register, please scan the QR code on the attached flyer or visit the following link (https://www.eventbrite.com/e/spring-thk-day-2023-tickets-611137156687). The event is open and free to the public. The deadline to register is Wednesday, May 3.
 
If you have any questions or need further information, please contact me at cashcraft@tma.thk.com or Alexis McCullough at alexismccullough@tma.thk.com.
 
Thank you so much for your time today, take care; we look forward to seeing you on May 4!

How to get your college credit at college.


1.) Wait until October. It takes some time for the college credit to transfer to COTC. The process can be slow.

2.) Go to your college advisor on your campus. Tell them you have college credit to transfer from COTC. They will help you out.

You have 2 types of credit, most likely. 

a.) CCP credit.That's already on your transcript (Database Admin, Programming)

b.) Articulated credit.
 That's not on your transcript unless you have already taken a CCP 
class. You can also attend a class at COTC, establish a transcript, and 
then the credit can be transferred. If you took a CCP class, you're fine. If not, then you have to take a COTC class to get this credit. (Database Admin, Programming, CMA, Game Design)  


Taking all of the classes will give you about 19 hours of credit. 


The credit will transfer, but it might not all count towards your major. It might count as elective credit.  Contact me for any questions you might have. 

Then, contact COTC if you have more questions. https://www.cotc.edu/post/transferring-after-cotc

I'm proud of all of you! Congratulations on your graduation!

Email from Ms. Kieffer about Licking County Foundation







We
 have locked in with LCF for a Zoom with their scholarship program 
officer, Amy Dell. LCF is one scholarship application, over 40 awards, 
$1K and up.


I am running the Zoom meeting from the SSC, but you can also have kids access from your rooms.


Here are the details. And thanks for your continued support of our programming!


Amy Dell, Program Officer from the Licking County Foundation will be on a Zoom for seniors on Monday 11am. 


Here are some tips to allow for a successful workshop:
·          Begin
 logging in at 11:00am. Mrs. Kieffer will admit you from the waiting 
room. The presentation begins at 11:10am; the LCF representative will 
work through the application and answer your questions. You will not be 
required to complete the application during this workshop; you will be 
able to save it and finish it later.
·          You
 will want to work on the application from a laptop, desktop computer or
 tablet - not a phone.  You may use your phone to log into and listen to
 the Zoom while you work on the application on your other device.
·          Use Google Chrome or Firefox as your browser (do not use Internet Explorer)
·          Have your first and last name displayed on your Zoom
·          Have
 your microphone muted and your video turned off.  We will use the Chat 
feature and there will be an opportunity for open mic questions at the 
end.


·          Be prepared to enter the following on the application:
o   Your cumulative GPA, as well as your Composite ACT score and/or SAT score (if you took either) 
o   Whether or not your parent(s) attended college and their current occupation
o   High School counselor name and email address
·          You do not need to know where you will attend school or what you will study
·          You do not need to attend a four-year school to apply
·          You do not need to have a 4.0 GPA in order to apply


Zoom details:
Topic: Get Started! Session - Lakewood High School
Time: Dec 13, 2021 11:00 AM Eastern Time (US and Canada)
 
Join Zoom Meeting

Hi! This is a place where I will put important stuff for seniors relating to scholarships, job opportunities, and other things seniors need to graduate! I promise to only use it for useful stuff.

The Johnstown Community Sportsmen's Club is offering $1,000 scholarships to eligible high school seniors in the following school districts or who are residents of the area served by these districts: Johnstown Monroe, Northridge, Utica, Watkins Memorial, Licking Heights, Lakewood, Granville, Newark, and Centerburg.
Eligibility requirements for this scholarship include the following:
Completed scholarship application
ACT composite score of 50th percentile or better
Proof of acceptance and enrollment to an accredited collegiate institution
Recommendation from HS principal or guidance counselor or their designate
GPA of 3.0 or better on a 4.0 scale

The 2021 deadline for application will be May 31, 2021. Here is the link: https://jcscohio.org/scholarship/

SCHOLARSHIP

Angels Persist LLC, located at 112 E. Coshocton Street in Johnstown, is pleased to be offering two one-time $1,000 scholarships for area high school seniors.  The application process is as follows:

    Write an essay/letter explaining what community service you have accomplished thus far and why you should be considered as a candidate.
    Attach a letter of referral from a non-related professional, i.e., Teacher, clergy, employer.
    Attach a record of your most recent mid-term transcript or grade card showing a GPA of 2.5 or higher and a record of your school attendance.  

Applications must be received by April 1, 2021. They can be delivered in person or mailed to Angels Persist LLC, 112 E. Coshocton St., Johnstown, OH 43031. (see that attachment for more information)

Hi! I wanted an easy way to email seniors and to share useful stuff for you. I get lots of info about scholarships, so I'll post the ones that might be helpful. 
I'm always willing to write letters of recommendation or help you fill out applications for college. Just let me know!

Hey! This is for sharing useful stuff for you people going to graduate in 2025. I share scholarship and job info here that might help you out. Feel free to share stuff you don't want to apply for so that others will do the same. For example, you don't want to be a nurse but you found a scholarship for nurses. 

There's also some extra stuff seniors need to do for CTEC, so I'll reach out here. But mostly, this is a community for sharing stuff.
